who lives alone, collects action figures, plays video games, and
his social life seems to consist of watching Survivor with his
elderly neighbors. Andy Taylor (Andy Griffith), now living in

Lou finally get married, with Ernest and the Darlings joining in

he nevertheless agrees to be Kay's best man at the wedding. Andy
is inspired by his father’s successful litigation, and in a

Andy is nearly fired after, due to drowsiness, he mixes up two
outgoing letters in the office mail. Andy is quite embarrassed by
their appearance together, but soon warms up to the bigger girl
and they become good friends. Andy is shocked however, when Kay
comes back to Wainwright and tells him that she has fallen in
love with her guardian Dane, and that she is planning on marrying
him the very next day. Andy is stranded outside in the garden,
and has to wait in the shrubbery until his parents arrive home
from the country club. Andy is troubled, however, when he falls
hard for Luis (Euriamis Losada), a charming, handsome virgin.
Andy is very determined though, to keep the romance a secret form
his parents. Andy lands a date with Trish Piedmont (Catherine
Keener), a woman he met on the sales floor. Andy lands the job,
and even gets to repeatedly date the office receptionist, a more
worldly woman who with the office staff are amused at his naivete
and sometimes clumsiness. Andy needs the money to purchase his
car, so he agrees. Andy offers to drive Susie around town and is
seen by Melodie, who immediately goes to the judge and asks him
to say that he accepted her invitation for Andy to come to the
dance. Andy prepares to tell Trish he is a virgin, but Trish
suggests that they postpone having sex. Andy reports for basic
training at Fort Ord, making it clear to everybody there that
he'd rather be anyplace else. Andy soon meets there another young
man who has just been fired as "office boy" at a midtown firm.
Andy starts going out with Cynthia, but she is bored by sports
activities, and they find they only get along when they are busy
kissing; after walking Cynthia home Andy stops in to visit Betsy
Booth—only he’s covered in Cynthia’s lipstick. Andy starts to
open up, and begins to form friendships with his co-workers. Andy
suggests a message be sent to their mother via ham radio in lieu
of sending her a telegram. Andy telephones her saying he can’t
take her to the dance because of a previous engagement. Andy
tells her about the notorious inn and warns her not to get
involved in a scandal. Andy then mentions that Barney's old
girlfriend Thelma Lou, newly divorced after less than two years,
is back in Mayberry staying with her sister; Barney nonchalantly
says he'll eventually go and see her. Andy tries to clear things
up with Polly but, having learned of his fling with Cynthia, she
angrily tells Andy that she won’t go to the dance with him
because she has a date with a college boy. Andy tries to convince
her otherwise and declares his love for her, but she leaves in
alarm and disgust. Andy wants them both to graduate, and "helps"
them out by editing the telegram to the father about the date for
traveling to the south, letting them stay a few days longer. Andy
wants to return to Wainwright college to finish his studies and
meet his sweetheart as soon as possible. Andy's attempt to help
his friends attend commencement results in another disaster — the
father's job offer is rescinded. Andy's dad, Judge Hardy (Lewis

Shakapopulis (Woody Allen). Caroline (Tomei) is a young woman in

agrees, but during the evening, Steve convinces her of his

Naish), the forger, and retrieves his money. Carter confesses

free her from her palatial prison. Don lends Jane the car to take
Richard to the train station, but she decides to stop being a

out into an apartment on his own, but Don finds himself all
alone. Don realizes that Lyda is just using him, that she does
not love him or even care about him. Don surprises Bebe by
proposing to her, and they get married on the spot. Don's friends
attend the show and laugh, particularly at his hijinks. Don's
mother also arrives for a visit unexpectedly early. Don, Kathy
and Cosmo come up with the idea to turn The Duelling Cavalier
into a musical called The Dancing Cavalier, complete with a
modern musical number called "Broadway Melody". Donald Morton

stopped by the combined efforts of Mickey and Goofy. Donna Jensen

(Shawn). Harold meets with Amanda to discuss the script and is
the only person who sees the same problems with the screenplay
that she sees. Harold races with Rich to get to Amanda's house
first so he can finally explain why he lied about being a writer.
Harold rescues her dog and helps Mary hide it from the conductor.
Harold rushes Maude to the hospital, where she is treated
unsuccessfully and dies. Harold saves himself, but Sally is
trapped by the circling boat. Harold tells Scott he is
responsible for vice principal Rusty Thorne breathing down his
neck, due to a scare he'd given him when he was in high school,
and advises him to be himself and not the wolf. Harold then spots
up-and-coming actress Amanda Clark (Fenn) arguing with her agent,
Sidney Stone (Williams). Harold tries to tell Amanda the truth
about himself, but can't bring himself to. Harold's father
answers, thinking he's talking to Lulu, and tells her to forget
about Harold because he's only interested in Hollywood floozies.
Harold's father finds out that Amanda accused him of being
obsessed with floozies and realizes that he is the reason they
broke up. Harper and Lance seem to be as close as they were in
the old days. Harper gets a phone call from Q and puts it on

up blood. Harper reluctantly agrees, but keeps the biography a
secret. Harper witnesses this from a distance and rushes to

the sheikh (Amr Waked) at his estate in the Scottish Highlands.
Harriet asks if he will need a partner—and Alfred realizes she is

manuscript to be not only worthy of publication but a serious

the managing director of a design agency; Mia (Heike Makatsch) is

service and is going through counseling with his wife, Adele
(Lauren Tom). Harry Mork (Glenn Ford) is a womanizing former
traveling salesman for a greeting card company, who now wishes to
settle down. Harry Tasker leads a double life; while his wife
Helen and daughter Dana believe him to be a run-of-the-mill
computer salesman, he is actually a black operative for a covert
counter-terrorism task force known as Omega Sector. Harry and
Helen are called to embark on a new mission together at a formal
party, where they encounter Simon attempting to seduce one of the
female guests. Harry and his partners Albert "Gib" Gibson and
Faisal infiltrate a private function in Switzerland, where they
learn of the existence of a Palestinian terrorist group known as
the Crimson Jihad, led by Salim Abu Aziz. Harry arrives and
toasts George. Harry becomes a Navy pilot and shoots down a
kamikaze plane that would have bombed an amphibious transport; he
is awarded the Medal of Honor. Harry becomes increasingly aroused
by Mia's overtly sexual behavior at the office and does nothing
to dissuade her. Harry begs her forgiveness. Harry commandeers
one of the jets to rescue his daughter. Harry considers himself a
ladies' man, but his confidence is temporarily shaken when an
Internet "dream date" turns out to be a prostitute (Janice
Hamilton). Harry does not go along with the idea, believing Vada
is too young to be traveling by herself, and fearing what might
happen to her inA. Harry has accepted a promotion to an office
job in New York City, and has gotten engaged to Phyllis (Angela
Lansbury), a middle-aged widowed housewife from Altoona,
Pennsylvania. Harry heads to Helen's office the next day to
surprise her for lunch, but overhears her talking on the phone to
a man named Simon. Harry is a natural-born liar who, because of
his profession, feels that he lives by a code of honor — even if
he can't quite explain it — as one thing after another spins out
of his control. Harry is able to rescue Dana while he and Aziz
struggle in the cockpit. Harry is comfortably married to his
wife, Karen (Emma Thompson), who stays home to raise their
children. Harry is mildly annoyed by Patrick's unexpected arrival
and embarrassed by his casual attitude towards women, sex and
nudity, particularly after Patrick moves into Harry's hotel room
with his purportedly platonic female friend, Émile Zola Bernkrand
(Joanna Crawford). Harry is staying alone in the same hotel as

is surprised to find that Patrick is not the young boy he had
expected based on a photograph, but instead is an 18-year-old
bohemian with a beard (which, it is later revealed, got him
expelled from school). Harry kills two of Aziz's men and pursues
the leader through the streets of Washington,C, but loses him on
a rooftop. Harry realizes that he truly loves Evie, and that
Patrick and Phyllis need to spend more time with each other
rather than with him. Harry refuses to give Dawg his piece and

enlists the help of his neighbor, dr Dreyfuss (Jack Kruschen), to
revive Fran without notifying the authorities and sends his
confused bar pickup home. He enters the waltz contest with Carol
and ends up winning the first prize. He entices Yardley into the
kitchen with the smell of cooking kidneys. He escapes from the
jail, and is leaving town with Rosie, when the Sheriff and Billy
track them down to let them know that the real jewel thieves have
been apprehended. He escapes with his life and writes a long
letter to Elizabeth explaining his actions. He even buys off her
private investigator (Dean Stockwell) that she hires to make a
background check on him. He even inspires Raff's followers with a
rousing speech, during which he says, "Just because you're stupid
that doesn't mean you can't rule a planet. He even kidnaps
Hildy's stern mother-in-law-to-be (Alma Kruger). He even lets his
friends believe he is romantically involved with Miss Fowler. He
eventually admits he does and the pair make-out on stage. He
eventually agrees and their friendship blossoms. He eventually
asks her to marry him, but she only invites him to dinner at her
home. He eventually begins drinking again and sleeps with another
woman in order to break off their relationship. He eventually
climbs up the side of the building and when he finally gets to
talk to Millie, she tells him she is quitting her job since mr
Graydon is no longer available. He eventually continues to dream
about her, and even soundproofs his apartment, and makes other
efforts to be able to sleep longer, so that he can remain with
Anna for longer periods of time. He eventually does, but falls
asleep at the restaurant after drinking grappa. He eventually
ends up tearfully telling his story to the store owner, mr
Crowley (Henry O'Neill). He eventually finds her in the library
about to have sex with another student, and drops a lit candle in
a bin in shock. He eventually invites Lisa to Sandy's opening
show, where he learns that Polly is leaving New York for
Cincinnati in a few hours. He eventually manages to free himself
and quickly learns that Nadia has been left behind after Alexei
discovered she was pregnant. He eventually starts dating a woman
named Sandy and grows to like her more and more. He eventually
starts down a steep cliff side, but is unable to find a way to
the bottom. He exhorts Bulworth, who is presumably inside, to not
be 'a ghost' but 'a spirit' which, as he had mentioned earlier,
can only happen if you have 'a song'. He exits, leaving his men
to dispose of Phelps. He experiences a few more peculiarities
about the American culture. He experiences a revelation during
his delirium and thanks God for his life. He explains about her
six smiles: one smile when something makes her laugh, one for
polite laughter, one for when she makes plans, one when she makes
fun of herself, one when she's uncomfortable, and one when she's
talking about her friends. He explains that he and Isabella are
booked for the Italian Music Awards, but she left Italy after
their breakup. He explains that he had everything but when his
father died, he lost confidence. He explains that he received a
surprise bequest of four thousand pounds a year from the American
millionaire, which has raised him to middle-class respectability,
and now must marry Eliza's "stepmother", the woman he has been
living with for many years. He explains that the Delta Gammas
have always been his dream girls—his Love Goddesses. He explains
that the voices are prayers to God, and that Bruce must deal with
them. He explains to Otávio that he is the João from the original
timeline in the body of his new-timeline-self. He explains to a
shocked Otávio that he has traveled through time, but the machine
is too dangerous. He explains to her that he was supposed to sail
to Bermuda last night (a trip paid for by his future father-in-
law) and that he has nowhere to stay and no money. He explains to
her that they must deal with their unfinished business. He
explains to the Joy Jumpers, particularly Mary, that the
freestyle routine needed to be redone due to being too boring; he
tells them that freestyle should be based on fun, and brings up
their childhoods when they enjoyed jumping rope and singing along
with it. He explains why he came back, and didn't feel good about
conning the girl he truly loved, and that the four girls have
changed him into now becoming an honest and decent man. He
explains why he missed their rendezvous and tells her that he
wants to stay in London and begin a relationship with her. He
explains why they are in the city, and when he asks her why Riley
does not like humans she explains that he was abandoned as a
puppy and decided to make a home for other stray dogs to protect
them from all humans. He expresses his frustrations by
intervening in a situation and boldly saving an elderly transit
passenger from being mugged, and by ranting about the general
corruptible state that the city has become. He expresses his
scorn for the seemingly heartless, ultra-rich man, who will not
lift a finger to help the multitudes of desperate poor. He
expresses some skepticism in marrying Kimmy, explaining that he
and Kimmy don't share a special song like he and Julianne do. He
fabricates a story about a competing magazine's attempts to hire
Elizabeth, and Yardley decides to hire her back at double her
salary. He faces the consequences of an encounter with Norma
(Sheila White) and the wrath of the husband of older Fay (Joan
Collins), when said husband discovers Alfie's wallet under their
bed. He faces the hardships of coming out to his widowed mother
Nuru, as well as hardships in his relationship with his boyfriend
Giles. He falls for her but doesn't know her true identity. He
falls in love at first sight with Sylvia Robertson, an
aristocratic woman, and poses as a prince to win her love. He
falls in love with Doreen (Lyell), who works in a pickle factory,
but faces competition from a more sophisticated rival, Stror 'at
Coot. He falls in love with Susanne, the goalkeeper of the local
girl's football team. He falls in love with a driver from the
motor pool, Emily Barham (Julie Andrews), who has lost her
husband, brother, and father in the war. He falls in love with
his costar (Betty Grable), who's secretly married to actor John
Payne. He features in the Stand in the Schoolhouse Door and
listens to George Wallace. He feels bad about it, but he breaks
up with Rebecca and tells her he is getting back together with
Kate. He feels that she is too nice a girl to convincingly play
the part, so she bets him that, in exchange for an audition, she
will be able to make Parker's friend, mining engineer Jack
Craigen (Edmund Lowe), fall in love with her within three days.
He feels trapped in a relationship where, as he observes, a wife
"does nothing to entitle her husband to divorce her, but a
thousand things that entitle him to murder her". He figures out

(George Clooney), a top divorce attorney and the inventor of the
"Massey pre-nup", a completely foolproof prenuptial agreement. He

He finally determines his mystery maiden is Patty. He finally

mother spots her and takes her away. He finally gets her to

in the west where he lives unmolested for eleven months. He
finally realized it—she is the love of his life, she is his

but only if she will accompany him. He finally shows his good
side by helping shovel coal. He finally wins over Brandi, only to
find out that he's really in love with Mia. He finally works up

rebuffs his advances. He finally works up the courage to ask her
out, to which she happily agrees. He finds Breezy at a park,
where they reunite and start their new life together. He finds
Joe and Mary under a romantic night sky on a balcony, and
believes Mary has fallen for the reporter. He finds Mary Tate at

together who tell Adam that they have decided to get married. He

with the rest of the Junkyard Dogs. He finds a fleur-de-lis

first class ticket because all coach seats are sold out. He gets

and arrogantly self-important head floorwalker, mr Stubbs. He

phoning because Sally's hogging it again. He gets drunk and is

to switch it on, when the front door shuts behind him and locks

He goes to the Hukilau Café to wait for the Coast Guard. He goes

He goes to the room where she is staying to hug her, when Agnes
and Chris suddenly come in. He goes to the wedding the same day,
only to have an annoyed Bart tell him that he can't let him in.
He goes with her to be alone at a waterfall. He graciously
understands and agrees to call off the wedding. He gradually
turns up the heat while watching Cathy intently for her reaction.
He grins, the film cuts to Gladys and Pete driving in a car and
discussing plans for the future. He grudgingly agrees to give her
a lift out of town and encourages her to go back to her parents.
He had been assigned by both Jackie's mother and the mayor of the
town (who is also his father), to act as Jackie's escort and
guide on the trip. He had been hinting throughout the movie that
he was interested in her, but was frustrated because she seemed
to never notice him and she was wasting her time with shallow
relationships with guys she could manipulate, rather than seeking
emotional intimacy. He had divorced her because she was always
involving him in real-life murder cases, but she wants him back.
He hails a policeman to have her put in a jail cell so that she's
kept somewhere safe, but when the cop arrives, she tricks him
into arresting Michael instead. He handcuffs the two together and

reveals an engagement ring set with a black diamond. He hands her

letter and confesses that he loved her from the moment he met

hands the baton to Danny, and he successfully dance-conducts his
own composition. He happens to be passing by, as does Julia
Wayne, when two halves of a ripped $1,000 bill float down to the
street. He happily does so, and then all the guests join them on
the dance floor. He happily goes back to Nita, and is last seen
on stage in the new Broadway play. He happily offers to take her
to Las Vegas. He has Jimmy look in the club's dining room; Jimmy
knows seven women there (the chances of the title). He has Paul's
car sent away and creates a fake rainstorm using a hose. He has a
book published and becomes a best-selling author on the subject.
He has a brief, quietly emotional conversation with Alyssa, and
gives her a copy of Chasing Amy, his new comic based on their
failed relationship. He has a fantasy that she is a femme fatale
overcome by his playing of Rachmaninoff's Second Piano Concerto.
He has a frequent fantasy sequence involving a merman (Brent
Corrigan). He has a group of tight-knit friends, which includes a
wacky girl named Connie; Anita, an emotionally distraught young
woman who constantly contemplates suicide; Robert, a young WASP
who fancies himself a poet; and Bernstein, a gay man. He has a
limited amount of magic to help him. He has a modest family life,
where he is a car tire salesman for Kate's father and Kate is a
non-profit lawyer. He has a nihilistic view of the world which is
why he never does homework and skips school frequently. He has a
reputation of womanizing female tourists and does not display any
interest in committing to a serious relationship. He has a
strained relationship with wife Penny, a plain and skittish woman
who is startled by a noise Jonathan makes and dies from a heart
attack. He has a suspicion that she has gone to a beach (Fire
Island, New York) that she told him about, the only place that
makes her feel truly happy. He has a tattoo on his abdomen that
reads "The Legend" with an arrow pointing down. He has also been
recently relieved of his faculty position at New York University,
further complicating the couple's financial position. He has also
been spending his time convincing the gullible townspeople that
he is actually a European noblemen. He has also met and fallen in
love with a colleague, Denise Gaines, who has developed a method
to isolate genetic material and later becomes his fiancée. He has
been told about the deception, and over dinner he explains that
he was serving in World War II when his wife (Amelia's mother)
died. He has cast a powerful spell that turns Odette into a swan
during the day, and she is able to temporarily turn human at
night if she is on the lake under moonlight. He has desired her
ever since, and now that Pearl is a widow, Joe feels the time is
right to make his move. He has done so to keep his fairy
godparents. He has even pushed his own sons into learning the
guitar and is seen riding them to become better. He has even
signed over his stock to Amelia, as he intends to remain in the
islands. He has everything figured out until he meets the acerbic
Kristin Peralta (Nadine Velazquez), a talk show circuit therapist
who is convinced that he is nothing but a charlatan. He has
explanations for everything else and demonstrates that his
conduct has been exemplary at all times. He has gone into
business for himself running a limousine service and owns a whole
fleet of limousines. He has him arrested, but Sherwood convinces
the police to give him time to straighten out the situation. He
has in essence become their butler, catering to their every whim.
He has learned that he may be liable for his wife's debts. He has
made a contract that his mother will not come to see him for at
least two months. He has meanwhile dropped his bid to become
department head and has become a more involved parent and
professor. He has no intention of being insulting, and is in fact
admiring Frank, but Frank’s facial expressions convey his own
self-loathing. He has realised that Suzanne doesn't want to marry
either of his sons, and takes her on a trip to look for Bill, in
an effort to join them once and for all. He has seven overbearing
sisters who ridicule and emotionally abuse him regularly and
leads a lonely life punctuated by fits of rage and anguish. He
has thousands of followers, including celebrities like Jessica
Simpson, Val Kilmer and Mariska Hargitay (Pitka's mantra is
"Mariska Hargitay"). He has two X-Files-obsessed friends wait on
the roof, while he goes into the party to drive Mike out. He has
two dogs entered in the competition. He heads to the Peace Corps
and confronts Ralph, believing he and Rosemary got back together.
He hears a gunshot and, upon discovering that Hightower has
killed himself, he instinctively drinks Hightower's blood. He
hears his own harsh words: "She's so deliciously low. He hears
that a friend, who is also a writer, has died in an accident, and
of whom only Roy knows that he had just finished a manuscript
that he had not shown to anyone else yet. He helps Jill move out
of her place and the two move in together by week's end. He helps
her and four other people board the moving train, but the train
leaves the station before he can get off. He helps her piece
together the truth about the deceased Charlie and deal with three
menacing people who are now following her. He helps her succeed
in getting the arrow to hit the bullseye, something she had been
struggling with. He helps his dad with his landscaping business
and takes care of Veteran's Field, where the Chatham A's play. He
helps install a new system for Penelope and her son Jake. He
helps the two couples by leaking the story of their engagements
to the press, forcing the earl to (reluctantly) accept the
situation. He hesitantly accepts, but he has a condition; if the
plan backfires and she isn't in a show by the end of the month,
Sharpay is forced to move back with her parents and work at Lava
Springs. He hides Lenore by letting her soak in a suds-filled
bathtub and then in the resort’s fish pond. He himself originally
purchased a swamp worth Rs. He hires John as the new CEO of
Deeds. He hires a local actor to play the part of his
grandfather, whom he calls Doo-Dah. He hitchhikes there and she
says, with a smile: "what took you f***ing so long. He hits a
three million dollar jackpot and Joy reminds Jack that they are
married and hence, she is entitled to half of the money. He hopes
that the introduction of excitement in her life will dissuade her
from leaving the family. He however, lives with his mother and
three younger siblings, acting as head of the family. He hurries
back to his office and condo in New York, but his closest friends
do not recognize him. He hypnotizes Hal into only seeing a
person's inner beauty. He ignores her threat to jump from a
window, and is so guilt-ridden when she does so immediately that
he marries her. He ignores her warning, and goes ahead with his
efficiency plan. He immediately accepts. He immediately confronts
Izzy about it, and Karin, despite her brother's objections, tells
their father that he had joined Mary's team. He immediately goes
on a spending spree, doing good deeds for friends and strangers
alike, worrying June Baylin, his fiancee. He immediately warns
the police, who arrive quickly to arrest him. He inadvertently
does so while Brendan is there too, and leaves Brendan to face
Sally. He inadvertently offends her, so Lisa moves out and spends
a pleasant, tipsy evening at George's modest new apartment. He
informs Mitch that he has been admitted to Pacific Technical
University, where he will room with physics "legend" Chris
Knight. He informs Peter and Zooey that he is, in fact, a
successful investor and returns the money he borrowed from Peter,
stating that the billboards were the couple's wedding present. He
initially approaches the gym representing himself as a
businessman looking to buy it, and acts relatively impersonal
with its staff, although he is strangely fascinated with the
world he discovers there (reflecting the expansion of physical
exercise to the mainstream which occurred in the 1970s). He
initially believes Tess is pregnant when she announces they're
having a child. He initially wants to do it, but ultimately
rebuffs her, unable to cheat on Maggie. He initially works as a
busboy, McDonald's cashier, sidewalk merchant, and limousine
driver. He initiates conversation with a stranger and recalls his
childhood in Greenbow, Alabama during the 1950s. He insists on a
raise. He insists on using it that same night and, as
compensation for such short notice, gives Baxter two company-
sponsored tickets to the hit Broadway musical The Music Man. He
inspires her to find her voice, which leads to some complications
in his relationship with Kate, forcing Reed to reexamine every
aspect of his safe, secure life. He instead brings Nick to a
runway so that he too can experience being caught in a landing
aircraft's turbulence. He instructs Jones to make a large deposit
for Mannion's mother's benefit at the First National Bank, where
police detectives are expecting Mannion to make another robbery
attempt. He instructs Matt to lure Jenny to a meeting where she
can be exposed to another meteorite that will draw away her
powers, leaving her a mere mortal. He instructs Puck to retrieve
the flower with the hope that he might make Titania fall in love
with an animal of the forest and thereby shame her into giving up
the little Indian boy. He instructs Sally to never let him be
alone with Simone and to not let him weaken. He intends to tell
the newspapers the real story about his "capture" of the German
soldiers. He intercepts the bridal party and convinces Sandra to
forgive Paul by sharing lessons learned from his own mistakes,
particularly that the pain of heartbreak is outweighed by the
regret of never risking one's heart in the first place, something
he admits to always regretting having done. He interrupts her
during the wedding reception she is attending and declares his
love. He introduces Gloria and Mae to his friend SgtTom Foster
(Warren Hull). He introduces her to a new approach to life; to
live every moment of her life and to do whatever she always
wanted to do. He introduces her to the finer things in life,
while Breezy stays true to her humility and charm. He introduces
himself to Jen and they happily hug. He introduces himself,
explaining the family name was originally "Delacroix" but his
grandfather tired of Americans pronouncing the "X" in the name.
He invents a method of flinging a net over a tree full of
monkeys, which the zoos want. He investigates, learning her real
identity. He invites Christina and Courtney to an after-party at
their hotel, but Christina goes home and later regrets not going.
He invites a co-dependent, seemingly "perfect couple" to share
his large apartment, only to see them completely disrupt his life
when they insert themselves into his new romance. He invites her

pay Britney $10,000 if she can manage to get Ashley back for him.
He offers to pay for a cab to take her to Boston but his credit
cards are declined. He omits his last name and makes an abrupt
exit with the children. He only accepts provided she keep their
bargain. He only helped Nicole because of his feelings for her,
and they kiss. He openly shows distaste for eating human flesh,
and is the only zombie there who is able to form four, coherent
syllables in one breath. He opens the letter and sees the result.
He opens the trunk and discovers an apparent dead body (Ellie's
boyfriend Kaiser, whom Al had not yet been aware of). He opens up
a fake art gallery pretending to be an artist named Deven Shah.
He opts for the night and, once he is asleep, she searches until
she finds the ring in the kitchen. He orders Lucky to buy the
painting, but Helen stops him, and Finchley gets the work for
$84,000. He orders Madison to get the film made. He orders
clothes to be sent from the store and takes her to a party. He
orders that all the resources of the planet should be engaged to
create his "Super Death Ray Laser"; the laser's purpose is to
destroy Earth, thus making Spengo the greatest planet in the
Universe. He owns a driving range in West Texas, where he drinks
and hangs out with his pal Romeo Posar (Cheech Marin) and their
friends. He panics, and in a desperate attempt to hide it from
his parents, he makes up an excuse to leave the club to help out
a friend. He passes - but only just. He passes Gwen on her way
home and she seduces him again, this time physically. He passes
out, but the following morning, she answers the door and
introduces herself as his fiancée to a crestfallen Julia. He
pauses a bit, turns around, and says that he is rather hungry,
accepts her invitation, and even offers to be the one who makes
breakfast. He pauses for a brief moment, and then turns around to
walk back towards the building as if he forgot something. He pays
bail, but Megan refuses to see him or even leave the holding
cell. He pays some men to pose as reporters and harass Connie at
the dock, so that he can "rescue" her and become acquainted. He
performs for them the song “Going My Way,” which he wrote on this
theme. He periodically pops in and out of Tillie's life, going
days without calling but showing up spontaneously at her door. He
permits her to spend the night while her dress dries. He
persuades Richard that he will be supportive of his date. He
persuades Romeo to caddy again, but develops a problem with his
swing. He persuades her to become his assistant, and potentially
his lover, beginning the cycle anew. He persuades her to try out
to win a snowboarding competition to win $25,000. He phones God
and asks him to do so. He picks a fight, but Will easily knocks
him down with a couple of punches. He pitches to Ken Griffey, Jr,
who on one pitch, launches it into the stands for a home run. He
places a bucket in the shower, and when she takes one it falls on
her head. He plans to propose to Elizabeth over Jane as he is led
to believe Jane is taken. He plans to return to his native
Austria late that night but vows to think of Sarah each Spring
("I'll See You Again"). He plans to take Jessie when she awakens
(along with her necklace) and hop a flight for Bermuda. He plays
along, almost seducing his wife's purported twin sister, but
stopping short each time. He plays the organ at church, has
unenthusiastic sex with his wife, Debbie, and spends his off-
hours searching for his biological mother, who had placed him for
adoption as a child. He plies Eriksen and his assistant Newton
with drugs, booze and hookers, and on the day of the contest,
they are busy with acts of debauchery as Santo is readying to
take the stage - hoping to beat his rival Dougie Stewart (fellow
bodybuilder Ken Waller in a memorable cameo). He pours his heart
out to Miri, proclaiming his love for her, which she
reciprocates. He pretends that mr Hamilton has answered in the
affirmative, only requesting that on Halloween the Careys must
have a ceremony for his dead mother and find a decent place for
her picture. He pretends to be an important Italian teacher
priest, who was instructed by the parents of a famous American
model (Natasha Hovey) to provide Italian lessons to settle in
Rome. He pretends to return her feelings so he can stay close to
Margit. He pretends to support her in her decision, while
secretly hoping that she will change her mind. He proceeds to
Susan's school, where he is the guest lecturer for the
day&mdash;and as he speaks, Susan becomes infatuated with him. He
proceeds to assault Anderson on the way to their wedding. He
proceeds to kiss Kitty who declares she considers herself not to
have been kissed at all, upon which the highwayman kisses her
several times and slips a ring on her finger leaving her
enraptured. He proceeds to the airport terminal, where he joins
Mason, Caroline, Bliss, and Del Valle. He proceeds to track down
Doug, who is back home in Minnesota, working in a steel mill and
a carpenter on the side, living with his brother and playing in a
semi-professional hockey league or hockey bar league on the side.
He professes his love for Mia on bended knees, and they share a
romantic kiss. He promised that if she ever left him, he'd give
her a second chance. He promises to attend the Mathlete Scavenger
hunt the following Saturday. He promises to send for his
girlfriend so they can get married once he has "made good" in the
big city. He proposes an outrageous wager with his rich Uncle
Carlton, that without clothes or money, Michael can make it from
New York City to Los Angeles in 10 days, and arrive there in a
new suit with $100. He proposes at his cabin and she accepts. He
proposes dinner à deux at his hotel and she decides to meet Aidan
for dinner. He proposes marriage and she accepts, but tells her
pal Marge that she has doubts. He proposes marriage to his
girlfriend Gina Vitale, but is shocked to be turned down. He
proposes to her but Ishika asks his real name, "Ricky Bahl" he
replied, and story ends with a love kiss. He proves to be strong,
but less skilled than Izzy. He provides Vada with valuable
information to help with her assignment, including home movies
and the answer behind the date written on the paper bag. He pulls
Kevin to shore and prepares to administer CPR. He pulls out a
book of stamps that he bought weeks ago because he knew it to be
one of the small things she loves. He pulls out the penny that

more. He pursues her, showing up with flowers at her real estate
office. He pursues the elegant and snobbish Eleanor (Olivia
Williams), art restorer by day and Salsa dancer by night. He puts
her in the car and walks into the wedding, getting Halley's
attention. He puts his London residence up for sale and returns
to Provence, entering into a relationship with Fanny. He puts two
and two together and realizes that Lili and Claire are the same
person. He quickly buys a ticket back to London and hires a taxi
driver to rush him back to the bank. He quickly gets dressed and
runs to the building where Alonzo works and is just in time to
meet Jhnelle there, suggesting they do something "better than
lunch" which is a movie at a theater in the hood. He quickly
switches from one character to the next depending on which woman
is present. He quits and moves to Montenegro. He quits his acting
job on a sleazy television prank show, his girlfriend, Andrea,
breaks up with him, and his agent, Herb, dumps him. He quits the
show and makes another attempt to win back Isabella. He races to
Chloe's apartment, only to find that she is heading off in a cab
with Guy, whom she embraces lovingly. He races to Mary's house,
pursued by furious females. He races to her home, but is told
that she has left for a study abroad program aboard a ship that
will keep her away for a full year. He re-encounters God, who
confronts Bruce about his selfish use of his powers. He reacts by
pushing her clear into the next room, knocking her unconscious.
He reacts by telling her how she doesn’t return his affections
and drags him along (You are so Fair). He reads her one of his
poems. He realises that lying can be used for helping others
rather than personal gain, and writes a screenplay about the
world being invaded by aliens in the 14th century, in which it is
claimed that everyone's memories were erased. He realizes his
error, writes his vows, and manages to win back Lola at the
airport before she leaves, proposing to her with "the first
diamond he ever bought". He realizes that Jody is in disguise as
Bliss, and they kiss. He realizes that Maggie was never meant for
him, ends his relationship with her for good and rushes to attend
Arthur's award ceremony. He realizes that he loves Hannah and
decides to tell her his feelings when she gets back. He realizes
that one must decide for oneself what is acceptable concerning
one's own faith and beliefs. He realizes that skilled musketeers
will jeopardize his plan and then goes to the janitor room,
telling Mickey, Donald and Goofy that they passed his test and
have what it takes to become musketeers. He realizes this is not
a healthy relationship pattern but doesn't know how to change it.
He reasons that those who are innocent will go to his suite,
while the murderer heads to the apartment to silence Mary. He
reassures her that he will pay the rent. He rebels against his
WASP upbringing, and to his parents' dismay, he romances two
black women. He receives motivation from his two "coaches",
Gordon (Dylan Moran), a well-meaning slacker who is Libby's
cousin and Dennis' best friend, who has made a hefty bet on
Dennis succeeding, and mr Ghosh Dastidar (Harish Patel) his
landlord, who uses unorthodox methods of training, such as using
a spatula to spank him. He recognizes her from the airport and
says "Hello," but Annie only responds with another "Hello" before
fleeing. He recognizes that he must resume his life as he becomes
frustrated seeing that his dog hasn't gotten over the loss
either. He recommends allowing Susan to date Richard until the
infatuation burns itself out; Tommy will drop the assault charge
if Richard complies. He reconnects with Stella, the elementary
school teacher, and continues acting. He reels in the bottom
half, leaving the irate Jennifer floating in the water without
pants. He refers to himself as a 'sharp-shooter' and the 'rave'
amongst ladies. He refers to himself as “R” since he cannot
remember his full name, among other details of his life. He
refuses and calls her a "bad sport". He refuses her money, saying
that he wants to encourage Timmy's optimism. He refuses money but
wants a job. He refuses to discuss it leading them to curtail
their honeymoon and return to London where Valeria learns that he
was on trial for his first wife's murder by arsenic. He refuses
to do this on principle, but finally consents to give Blent an
oral retest while the game is in progress. He refuses to do this,
but is unable to return the money as he does not know who is
behind the bribe. He refuses to go any farther, holding the
wheels of his wheelchair and finally getting up out of his
wheelchair and walking himself and his wheelchair home, exposing
that he doesn't need it. He refuses to help them as he thinks
they can help themselves for being high privileged. He refuses to

but in the end, Laida returns to help. He refuses to take Sally's
calls and avoids her. He refuses, implicitly revealing the truth
about himself and Omar and she departs wordlessly. He regains his
ability to walk one day in church, where Deborah, now clean and
sober, reconciles with Brian. He regains his voice to tell Ina he
loves her and, in the end, they kiss. He rehires Eliot on the
spot, and they take over the live show by holding Brice and the
control box at gunpoint. He reinstalls the time machine, dresses
up as a spaceman, and then travels back to 1991. He relents, on
the condition that she wear a carnation. He reluctantly agrees
and the two begin a rigorous practice regimen over the following
weeks. He reluctantly agrees to do it, but discovers afterward
that she was not telling him the full truth: an a-morphic
zerophiliac can still change by having sex with another
zerophiliac, and dr Catchadourian was using Luke to change
herself one last time (into a man), leaving Luca as a woman in
the process. He reluctantly lets her in for a meal and soon she
tells him her story. He remains withdrawn and begs off early. He
remembers Bill's talent and pitches the idea of having a man
climb the "12-story Bolton building", which De Vore's occupies.
He remembers little of the night and knows little about his
houseguest. He repeated the ritual every year until he was 18,
and he has never been in a diner since. He replaces her with
Janet, hoping that Bruno will back his revue (or at least that he
can use Bruno's reputation to fend off impatient creditors). He
replies that “he can't answer that right now”. He reports the
incident to the police with his attorney Orlando present; and the
two go to a diner where Vladimir rants about his misfortunes. He
reprimands Henry for his attitude, leaving him with the slipper.
He requests for her bedroom and carries her inside. He resolves
to leave Sophie and go away with his old flame. He responds by
initiating a sexual encounter in her parked car. He returns
between the ceremony and the reception to check on her, and
discovers that she is having an affair with his brother. He
returns her wallet, explains that he and June are not involved,
and then kisses Sarah just as Jake gets back. He returns home to
find Alice trying to call off the whole deal. He returns home to
find his parents laughing over their honeymoon recollections. He
returns home to retrieve his suit and police catch a bloodied
Griff and later release him with a warning. He returns late at
night, and as O’Malley puts the older priest to bed, the two
begin to bond. He returns the money he stole from them, and
leaves. He returns to France to find her and ends up walking
through town, gathering people as they walk to her job at a
restaurant. He returns to New Jersey hoping to finally be with
her. He returns to New York, where he regains his form at work,
and reconciles with Connie. He returns to her and they discuss
the possibilities of having a child and getting married. He
returns to the country club to break the news to his partner and
the lawyer. He returns to the hotel, only to learn from the
maître d' that Sarah has gone out with Peter for the evening. He
returns to the party and waits there to talk with Teddy when she
returns home. He returns to the room and drives off the unhappy
gigolo. He reveals Dudley's true identity to Professor
Wutheridge, who urges him to stand up and fight for the woman he
loves. He reveals he ended it with her and learns of Julia's
plans to marry Glenn. He reveals his identity to the mayor and
tells him of his grandmother's support for the mayor. He reveals
his true identity to the thoroughly-embarrassed Nancy, and as he
has taken a fancy to her, he asks her to dance. He reveals that
he bought the house across from her aunt and presents Nora the
front door key, attached to an engagement ring. He reveals that
he has a wooden prosthetic hand, and he explains that he blames
Johnny for the loss of his hand and his own fiancée; Ronny became
distracted while talking to Johnny as he cut bread for him, his
hand was mangled in the slicer, and his fiancée left him. He
reveals that the Hot Chili Steppers went to the State
Championship, but did not win until the following year, and that
Izzy and Mary were still going strong as a couple. He reveals
that their parents are still alive, having escaped to a
safehouse. He reveals to a stunned wedding party that Joanna left
him at the altar. He reveals to her on one date that he
(supposedly) never quite mastered Albert Einstein's theory of
relativity. He reviews the day he just had, which ended with his
getting fired after discovering his department head Niles
Pender's (Hart Bochner) scheme to sell the company under the nose
of its owners to a group of naive Japanese investors. He reviews
the recording he made of the morning Eliza first came to him for

perfume counter at Bloomingdale's under the skirt of the clerk,
Lucia Lombardo. He runs into Flostre and learns that Jo bashed
him on the head with a vase. He runs into Lieutenant Dan, and
finds that the former officer is now in a wheelchair and has
become an embittered drunk living on disability pension. He runs
one last con to break Phillip out of prison, only to be caught
when he runs into an old co-worker. He runs out of his wedding to
live with Nancy, and tries to find himself with the aid of a
guru. He runs out of the store to confront Maggie and realizes
that she has been cheating on him. He rushes and catches her with
a few smooches while she wriggles her way out. He rushes out to
get on a plane to find her. He rushes over to her house to offer
his assistance, but sees Charles through the window, and realizes
the real reason for her rejection. He rushes to the airport,
furiously calling the bank in Mumbai with the help of a Hindi-
speaking cab driver. He rushes to the church and arrives just as
Elaine is married. He saw that the timing was perfect,
considering that his parents will leave the house for a week. He
says both his brother, Gordon, and his mother are dead. He says
both were exactly the same. He says he and the princess are to be
married. He says he does not care and wants to marry her. He says
he does not want Tess Harding or "just mrs Sam Craig," but
instead "Tess Harding Craig". He says he has a gift for her. He
says he has confessed his cheating to her mother and they are
still trying to work things out. He says he hated his job and
that he decided to do what she would do: quit his job and go back
to what he loved – writing music. He says he's a poet and an
investor. He says his mother died by getting kicked in the head
by a cow. He says no, revealing that his wife died two years
earlier. He says that he has something to ask her, but is
interrupted by Jake, and says he'll talk to her later. He says
that he will not be saved until he can convince Inès to trust in
him. He says that it does not matter what everyone else may think
about John and Joanna getting married: all that matters is that
they love each other. He says that it might be something that the
two of them would laugh about years later, but Megan is still
angry because she had to spend time in jail. He says that it was
what worked out the best for his success, and she tells him that
she could have had those opportunities, too. He says they'll
figure it out, and tells her to continue with their plan. He says
this while lighting up a Lucky atop a snow-capped mountain, where
he lies down as the snow gradually covers him up, but his plans
are scuppered by rainfall melting his would-be tomb. He says,
"And ere I take this charm from off her sight,/As I can take it
with another herb,/I'll make her render up her page to me". He
scores big and adapts to the gambler's lifestyle, gaining respect
from Bendetta's spoiled friends. He scurries right off with the

fastened to Julie's ears and cannot be removed. He secretly
arranges for Henry to be offered a good job in South America, but
Henry finds out about his hand in it and turns the opportunity

against the WBA women's welterweight champion, Billie "The Blue
Bear", a German ex-prostitute who has a reputation as a dirty
fighter. He seeks help from dr Brubaker, but to no avail. He
seeks out his old teacher Ron, who forces him to confront the
reasons he quit dancing in the first place. He seems to want to
do a makeover on June when he apparently sees her inner beauty.
He seems unchanged and has still not finished writing his
doctoral thesis on Martin Heidegger. He sees an ad for a roommate
and talks the reluctant young woman, Connie Milligan (Jean
Arthur), into letting him sublet half of her apartment. He sees
her on the street and offers to give her a tour of the real
Paris. He sees his family's faces for the first time, but not
Leeza's, who was away, reluctantly preparing for her marriage. He
sees no real future for himself, rather an entire life supported
by the Icelandic welfare state. He sees that she is with Ronny,
and he suggests that they simply agree that they didn't see each

and defies his agent by going to the game to help Darren, as well
as show Jane (who manages to stand up to the angry crowd) his

does not recognize her. He selects a pretty place called
"Crooning Water" where she stays with Horace Dornblazer (Newall),

Porsche 911, buys a family van, and gets back together with
Rebecca. He sends an invitation to Rachel for the opening night
performance. He sends for Corkle and convinces him that he is Joe
(by playing his saxophone just as badly as he did in his previous
incarnation). He sends for Duke Sheldon, who plants oil on a lot
George owns. He sends for two eligible bachelors from America on
the pretense of business. He sends her home to talk to her mother
about her situation, but Nancy misunderstands him and thinks that
he meant for her to discuss their impending marriage with her
mother. He separated Jane and Bingley out of fear that Jane had

two, but Ina shows no interest in Chris, only able to think of
Lincoln. He shares a rented room with his pal "Limpy" Bill, a
construction worker. He shares with Stacy that he started driving
from his home in New Jersey just to take a drive and, the next
thing he knew, he found himself in Chicago, Illinois. He shares
with her his dream to become an Olympic Roller Skater. He showers
her with expensive gifts. He shows Piper, Jen, Tish, and Priestly
his high school yearbook, demonstrating that he was captain of
the football team and class president. He shows her the kitchen,
where Manuel is sleeping off the previous night's celebration in
the linen basket. He shows his evidence to his son, who hires
detectives to watch Lil. He shows the book to his friends Nathan
and Lube and explains that it is a sex manual that has been
compiled over forty years by the students who found it. He shows
up at Eva's job on a white horse and persuades her to forgive
him. He shows up at her apartment unexpectedly and sees her
without her disguise, so she has to pretend to be her roommate
Sadie (Patsy Kelly). He shrugs it off, saying, "I like it" (this
has caused the cartoon much controversy for implying
sadomasochism). He simultaneously receives more attention from
Carol. He sincerely promises not to do so with the staff of the
Regent. He sits in the dark every Thursday night, waiting for her
to show up. He slaps Ben again, who, in turn, punches Zach. He
slaps Pearl after Mickey runs out, assuming they slept together.
He sleeps for only 13 minutes and has to stay up for eight
months. He slips and falls into his bathtub while holding an
electric hairdryer, shocking himself. He slowly gains Julie’s
trust, and convinces her to stay for a while until the others
forget about her (though in reality, he just really likes her).
He slowly reveals himself to be a callous, social-climbing, gold-
digging gigolo, and Julia is shattered when their affair comes to
an end. He sneaks in, but then reveals that he is an escapee from
a nearby mental asylum and thinks he is "Boney". He sneaks into
Tabby's limo before it pulls in and he talks to her, and it is a
moment in which he finally realizes he must grow up. He sneaks
into the house with the minstrels playing that night at the ball,
where her parents are arranging her betrothal to Lord Wessex, an
impoverished aristocrat. He sneaks up, knocks Cornelius out, and
takes a resisting Tansy back to London. He soon apologizes,
however, and they kiss not much later. He soon comes across
Hubbie the Ghost (Ralph Macchio), who helps Danny with his girl
problems. He soon discovers that Cindy Jo is his wife and he's
the president of his company, Liberty Republic Sporting Goods. He
soon discovers that his neighbours are a loose troupe of
performers led by Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec (John Leguizamo). He
soon discovers the exact trouble and orders mrs Orrin to bed with
instructions that she not even see her daughter. He spends an
uncomfortable night in a chair. He spends his days drinking with
friends and creating disturbances across his father's estate. He
spends much of the film washing his hands, all the while singing
the "Happy Birthday" song—an attempt to gauge the proper length
of time for the process. He spends the next three years wondering
what went wrong - until he gets the unexpected chance to travel
back in time and alter that night, and his fate, over and over
again. He spends the night talking with a few girls, but he
doesn't sleep with any of them. He spent his early adult years in
Virginia Beach as a police officer. He spots her on television
and tracks her to the studio. He sprinkles his second gift, a
packet of glittery "magic wishing dust". He stages elaborate fake
suicides, attends funerals and drives a hearse, all to the
chagrin of his socialite mother (Vivian Pickles). He stakes his
reputation on his mathematical calculations that show Colossal
should turn a profit. He stands in lines for hours to buy toilet
paper and shoes. He stares dreamily at the stage where Vicki is
performing her act. He starts to develop feelings for his best
friend, Julie (Michelle Trachtenberg). He starts to walk off the
stage, but then comes back and decides to chant with them
instead. He starts working for a Peace movement to get to know
Britta. He stays with Gregory in his house, and after listening
to an answer message that Isabelle's rabbit, Bongo, has died, he
runs to comfort her. He stays with Sharp while they await the
arrival of "Social Services"—an otherwise nameless woman with
plans to place Sam in a "juvenile refuge" and to explore the
possibility of treating him with electroshock therapy. He steals
the letter, and believes that his wife is having an affair. He
still lives with his mother (Chus Lampreave). He still yearns for
a reconciliation with Laura. He stops for her, having
difficulties driving the car, and asks for directions to Beverly
Hills. He stops her just in the nick of time and offers her a
position for which she previously applied. He stops singing "La
donna è mobile" and begins "Easy to Love", during which Dick gets
up and sits next to Nora, where they hold hands and snuggle. He
storms off as Tenley comes in, who follows him outside. He storms
out, but she persuades him to take her back. He storms over to
Simpson's office, and Simpson tells Ryan that he personally
screwed him over because Ryan was sleeping with his wife. He
struggles with an attacker, who loses his footing and tumbles
over a cliff. He struggles with defining career and
relationships, and after his best friend Brooke moves away, finds
himself falling for Sophie, a downtown photographer. He struggles
with low self-esteem, as well as a bullying coworker and rival,
Drew, who constantly dominates Julia's attention, a romantic
interest for Bruce but sexually for Drew. He stumbles from one
temporary job to the next, and he has very serious problems with
Heinrich, his rich and influential stepfather, as well as with
his brother Viktor. He stumbles into the cabin of Black Larsen, a
wanted criminal. He successfully composes the soundtrack. He
successfully woos Fanny into his bed, where she leaves him the
next morning, expecting him to return to his life in London. He
suddenly kisses her goodbye outside. He suffers from obsessive-
compulsive disorder which, paired with his misanthropy, alienates
nearly everyone with whom he interacts. He suggests getting
someone to pose as Finch's sweetheart to get him out of
difficulty. He suggests she first marry him discreetly, then
divorce him publicly. He suggests that she could portray the
maid, since she was an unexpected addition to the scenario. He
suggests there is a jinx. He suggests they kiss first, to get it
out of the way. He supports himself by writing for glossy
magazines, in addition to the tiny royalty checks that
occasionally arrive in his mailbox. He suspects customer Connie
Ennis (Janet Leigh) of being a comparative shopper for a rival
store when she buys an expensive toy train set without asking a
single question about it. He suspects his neighbor (and bridge
partner) George Ryan. He suspects that Joe knows where she is and
tries to get him to admit it, but Joe claims to know nothing
about it. He switches the love serum meant for Marge with water
and informs her of his intentions to search for Dick, but Spengo
overhears Afir's plan and has him placed in the barrel of the
laser, to die when Earth is destroyed. He takes Eve away from the
mother, but after Henry accuses the doctor of being a fortune
seeker, the doctor refuses to have anything to do with Eve. He
takes Gil to meet Stein, who agrees to read his novel and
introduces him to Pablo Picasso and his lover Adriana. He takes
Helen out to dinner and gets her to start teaching him about art.
He takes Meena back to her father and tries to make him
understand and honour his daughter's wish. He takes Mia home,
leaving Q and Harper the last two to leave the shelter. He takes
a break from his playboy lifestyle to attend his brother's (Paul)
wedding, where he becomes reacquainted with Jenny Perotti
(Jennifer Garner), Connor's childhood friend and the only girl
who's ever captured his heart. He takes a fancy to her and lets
her in on his racket, conning people out of money. He takes a
fatherly approach and gives her room/board, but never acts on
sexual opportunities. He takes an interest in his waitress, Carol
Connelly, the only server at the restaurant who can tolerate his
behavior. He takes her back to his filthy apartment and they
agree to sleep together. He takes her back to his mansion. He
takes her for a walk, they kiss, and he gives her the earrings.
He takes her home and meets Judith's mother, Miss Sarah (Ella
Joyce). He takes her on a tour through Central Park, and another
day they venture for fun across the city and use their self-
defense skills to fight a bully named Daryl Kitzens and try to
inspect an apartment for rent, worrying his nervous parents. He
takes her to Los Angeles and tries to introduce her to Felix
Hofer (Sakall). He takes her to a nearby art gallery. He takes

and Michael's favorite hangout and once come close to having sex.
He takes her to see the New York Yankees play baseball. He takes

17th century France and perhaps troubled by sartorial
impracticalities, have suggested that Perrault's "glass slipper"
(pantoufle de verre) had been a "squirrel fur slipper" (pantoufle

intoxicated and invites him home for a lavish party. Later that

her boss comes back a week early, and gets into an argument with
Nick (which ends with Nick jumping on him, then Thea pulling them
apart). Later that evening at the Jumping Germans' camp, one of

at 5 PM. Lattimer is extremely wealthy and willing to make up the
shortfall in exchange for Diane. Lattimer refuses at first, but
soon caves in to the outrage. Laura Partridge (Judy Holliday), a
minority stockholder with just ten shares of stock, drives its
arrogant, self-serving executives to distraction with her
incessant questioning during this and subsequent meetings. Laura
and Frank go to a dinner where they hope to reconcile. Laura
finds the present disgusting and leaves without making up with
him. Laura reconnects with Frank. Laura takes her advice to
heart. Laura tells Amelia that she believes that she and Andrew
are going to make itThe two leave to go to the ceremony hand in
hand. Laura then goes to her chiropractor, named Matt (Lee Pace)
where she dresses up in revealing underwear and tries to seduce
him, who at first refuses her advances, but eventually gives into
them. Laure, a blonde who was introduced to him by his friend
Jacques (Richard Berry), told Etienne on January 1 that she will
not have sex with him until May 27 that year at precisely 9pm.
Laurel, however, is not who she pretends to be. Lauren King
(Diane Lane) is a book-smart 13-year-old American girl with an IQ
of 167 living in Paris with her affluent family. Lauren and
Daniel meet Julius Santorin (Laurence Olivier), a quirky but
kindly gentleman, literally by accident. Lauren apologizes to
Nick for thinking he was sleeping with Darla, but he interrupts
that he's met Brad and knows that SHE was trying to have an
affair on HER husband with him, leaving Lauren in shock. Lauren
approaches Nick and says that he was right - she had trust
issues. Lauren avoids Nick's calls, trying to sort out her own
trust issues. Lauren finally tells her that Brad is an adulterer.
Lauren goes to the fire station, where she finds only Jay - Rick
is in Tahiti on Jay's honeymoon, and Nick will be finishing up
after a fire for hours yet. Lauren loses her temper, accusing
Darla of hurting everyone who cares about her and Darla leaves
angry. Lauren murmurs to Nick that he is cute and she knows she
shouldn't like him before passing out; Nick stays so that Lauren
is not left alone. Lauren refuses, but acknowledges to herself
that she misses the challenges and joys of her job. Lauren says
she doesn't date clients, so Nick says fine-then he is out of the
wedding, and kisses her on the way out while she reels from this
new bombshell. Lauren says this can't wait, and Jay gives her a
ride with sirens wailing and lights flashing to the site. Lauren
then reveals that she will be moving back to the United States
permanently in two weeks. Lauren visits the office and G begs her
to come back. Lauren wants everything perfect, despite her
dislike of Darla, her own hurt feelings, and her resurfaced
issues of trust. Lauren's main relief is the humour and
camaraderie of Marc (Barry Julien), Darla's long-suffering,
overtly gay aide. Lauren's self-absorbed mother (Sally
Kellerman), who consorts openly with her movie director boyfriend
George in front of Lauren and her stepfather (Arthur Hill),
fiercely objects to the romance, calling Daniel a "filthy French
boy". Lauren's sister Lily is staying over, but is not in when
they get there. Laurence sees Martha running off in the distance
but is unable to catch her. Laurie rides shotgun with Bob as Toad
starts the race. Lavish gifts arrive for Pert to wear to the next
date. Lawford dances while singing a song, a performance that was
particularly well received by both critics and public, outshining
future fellow Rat Pack member Sinatra. Lawrence "Larry the
Liquidator" Garfield (Danny DeVito) is a successful corporate
raider who has become rich buying up companies and selling off
their assets. Lawrence "Rip" Smith (James Stewart) is a former
basketball player and ex-military who now runs a company that
perform polls and consumer surveys. Lawrence fakes a visit to the
emergency room to see Janet again and the two reconcile for a
second date. Lawrence goes to the hospital for a follow-up, where
another doctor tells him Janet had been his student. Lawrence has
to figure out a way to get about without being able to operate
his car; Chuck is without a place to sleep and a job so Vanessa
sets things up for what he characterizes as a "win/win"
situation. Lawrence loves Ellie, and she outwardly reciprocates
while masking her doubts about their relationship. Lawrence
suffers a trauma-induced seizure after falling from the top of a
fence in an attempt to retrieve his briefcase from inside his
impounded car. Lawrence, a teaching assistant, and Ellie have
been together for about a year. Laxman Pandey (Atul Kulkarni), a
right-wing political party activist, joins the cast later,
despite initially being unpopular due to his anti-Western
ideology, due to which he is often at odds with the other four,
and anti-Muslim beliefs and contempt for Aslam Khan. Layla allows
herself to be kidnapped and it is clear she is romantically
attracted to Billy from the start, but Billy all the while is
compelled to deal with his own demons, his loneliness and his
depression. Le Cocq, having overheard that Darren cannot play
with his mother in the audience, gets Darren's mother to sing the
national anthem, causing Darren to run out of the game. LeBlanc
persuades O'Hara to return to the Baron and work as a spy.
Leahy's mother, unimpressed with Keaton's bank account but
interested in Beery's, decides on Beery as a match for her
daughter. Learning from him that he has met someone, she accuses
him of having had an affair during their marriage. Learning of
the "scandal", Willie's widowed mother, mrs Hammond, "old maid"
Aunt Harriet, younger sister Patricia as well as family
dressmaker Camille, all return from New York, along with Alvin
Bailey and Alvin's physical trainer and sidekick, the big "dumb"
Champ. Learning that Irma is pregnant, Nestor escapes from
prison, with Moustache's help, and returns to Irma. Learning that

want very much to wed. Maria Owens, a young witch, is exiled to
Maria's Island in Massachusetts with her unborn child for
escaping her execution. Maria finally forgives him. Maria is
escorted down the aisle but storms off to the vestry after seeing
the drunken Gus, believing that he is not taking this wedding
seriously. Maria is furious and Ray apologizes with a kiss. Maria
is given legal custody of Casey. Maria is impressed and
volunteers to be Ray's translator while in town. Maria obeys her
uncle and leaves the room; a disappointed Eddie calls her a
"slave". Maria scoffs at Gus' insistence that they must marry
again after fifty years together, but agrees to do it if Gus
proposes to her properly. Maria wants the wedding she never had.
Maria's current romantic interest is Anton (Paul Henreid), a poor
Polish count who fancies himself a sculptor. Maria's youngest
sister, 18-year-old Nina (Anna Maria Alberghetti), takes an
almost immediate liking to Ray. Maria, who by now is eagerly
awaiting the next love letter from her secret admirer, sees Bob
dropping off the note and flower and concludes that he is her
suitor. Marian thinks that Carvel is too unsophisticated for her
and is annoyed by her family's worries that she is dating Jeff
Willis, a local young man who is considered a "wolf". Marianne
Bryant, a prissy and strictly religious Christian at their
school, overhears her telling the lie and soon it spreads like
wildfire. Marianne departs hastily, anxious to avoid becoming
entangled in a scandal. Marianne's religious clique, which now
includes Rhiannon, begins harassing Olive in order to get her to
leave school. Maribel (Tamara Mello), the youngest, is hip and
slightly rebellious. Maribel is drawn to handsome Brazilian
student Andy after her co-worker rejects him and, after they
briefly date, she invites him home for dinner, during which she
blithely announces she is moving in with him, much to her
father's consternation and Andy's shock, since they never had
discussed elevating their somewhat casual relationship to this
next level. Marie and Dan meet to talk at a bowling alley. Marie
jealously watches Dan and Ruthie. Marie's parents would prefer
their daughter to marry Tommy, but things get complicated when
Marie's father, Warren, needs to sell a piece of property he owns
in order to get himself out of financial difficulty. Marietta
slyly decides to recruit him to end Melody's marriage. Marietta
still hates Boris and continues to arrange for Melody to marry
Randy. Marilla becomes suspicious of Mike after she finds a
photograph of Lori Shannon (Dolores Gray), Mike's former
girlfriend. Marilla designs clothes for a wide array of artistic
personalities. Marilyn (Brenda Vaccaro) is a woman unexpectedly
plunged into grief when her otherwise healthy husband is killed
by a woman (Renée Taylor) backing her car out of a driveway.
Marina follows Nancy to her mother's house, and privately tells
Frances about Nancy's supposed pregnancy. Marion also expresses a
crush on Wade. Marion is a French-born photographer living in New
York City with her neurotic, hypochondriacal, chain-smoking,
heavily tattooed American interior designer boyfriend Jack.
Marion soon discovers an ominous lump in her breast, which proves
fatal. Marisa Ventura is a single mother trying to get by with
her 10-year-old young son Ty by working as a maid for The
Beresford Hotel in the heart of Manhattan. Marisa is unable to
end the affair, and she spends the night in Chris's hotel room.
Marissa is Roxanna's best friend from childhood, and Jesse's ex-
girlfriend. Marissa sympathizes and forgives him. Mark Bellison
(Ricky Gervais) is a screenwriter, in a film industry limited to
historical readings because there is no fiction. Mark Christopher
(Powell) is a successful thirty-five-year-old Hollywood
screenwriter who has suffered from partial writer's block since
winning an Academy Award and has been unable to produce a decent
script. Mark and Patrick are two friends who work for an internet
based magazine. Mark and Patrick both fell for her but Patrick
hides his true feelings for the sake of his friend Mark. Mark and
Tomas and Alex and Grace go out dancing at a big-city gay club,
where they see Ray Ray, the son of Alex's family housekeeper,
performing as a drag queen called Obsession. Mark and his
girlfriend (Kristen Wilson) are hung up over moving in together;
Runyon is hung up over his old girlfriend Kathryn (Dana Wheeler-
Nicholson), who has moved to Los Angeles; the womanizing Josh is
hung up on Phil's sister, Gina (Paige Turco), who has an abusive
husband; Phil, who is married with children, finds himself hung
up on an English interior designer (Kristin Scott Thomas). Mark
convinces Anna to go out with him again; she congratulates Mark
for his financial success and admits that he would be a good
husband and father, but she is still not attracted to him. Mark
has an epiphany that enables him to tell the world's first lie,
to the effect that he has $800 — the amount he owed his landlord
— in his account. Mark has his own confession: he is in love with
Susan but is worried by their age difference. Mark hires Tomas to
re-paint his dining room. Mark is naturally appalled, but is
eventually persuaded to take the girl in. Mark is not really in
love with Jennifer like Patrick. Mark just wants to sleep with
her. Mark reluctantly attends Anna and Brad's wedding, where he
objects to the marriage, but the officiant informs him that only
the Man in the Sky can stop the wedding. Mark soon receives
worldwide attention for his supposed new information about death.
Mark then gets a call that his mother has had a heart attack and
rushes to the hospital. Mark then slips away to a cabin in the
Sierra Nevada mountains to work on his script with Maude. Mark
wants to lie but does not because of his love for Anna, and says
no. Mark's secretary Maude Snodgrass (Glenda Farrell), his best
friend Virgil (Alvy Moore), and his lawyer Harvey Butterworth
(Les Tremayne) do their best to keep the situation under control.
Mark, a Wall Street financial broker, falls in love with a French
actress at first sight, due to her resembling a Vermeer painting,
and then proceeds to follow her from room to room in a museum.
Mark, the son of the publisher, objects to his father, but
because Mark is himself struggling with his homosexuality and
attending meetings of an ex-gay group at the local church, he's
limited in what he can do to mitigate the story and the resultant
damage. Mark, through tears, tells her that death instead brings
a joyful afterlife, introducing the concept of a Heaven to her,
and she dies happy. Marla convinces Trish to go and make up with
Andy. Marlo has recorded extensive details about her affairs and
scandals, with a lot of dirt about her husbands and lovers. Marlo
is expected to work "undercover" to ensure world peace. Marlowe,
meanwhile, is miserable; she thinks she is falling in love with
Hunter, but her one real true love is the man who discovered her,
George Schmidlap (Groucho Marx). Marni and Will's little brother,
Ben (Billy Unger), loosened the screws as a part of his plan in

she was only trying to protect him. Marni appears to start a
relationship with Charlie (Sean Wing), her brother's best friend
who has always been kind to her. Marni decides to bring Tim to
the rehearsal dinner as part of her plan to stop the wedding.
Marni forgives her and promises to get them back together. Marni
is also upset to see that Joanna fits in very well with the
family. Marni is in trouble when everyone discovers that she was
responsible for the video at the rehearsal dinner. Marni is now
convinced that Joanna hasn't changed, and walks away. Marsha ends
up asking Darvac to pretend to be Roogle, but has to knock out
Darvac when he tries to claim his privileges as her "husband".
Marsha goes to her friend Kitty's cabin in the mountains to get
away from the limelight. Marshal, Karen Sisco, are forced to
share a car trunk during Foley's escape from a Florida prison.
Marshall Thomas (Houston Rhines), an advertising designer, and
his partner of seven years, cafe owner Gabe Horton (Noah
Schuffman), who live in Los Angeles, California, are in a rut.
Marshall discovers a smart phone application called eCupid and
agrees to install it without reading the terms of agreement
(despite multiple warnings) The application (voiced by Morgan
Fairchild) proceeds to take over Marshall's phone and computer,
and by proxy his life. Marshall then arrives, jealous. Martha
goes to a bar where she drops her quarter in front of the
jukebox. Martha introduces Whitman to her family and he impresses

get arrested so she can end up in the next cell, holding hands
with Petey between the bars. Martha replaces him and becomes
successful. Martha slips away and heads for the exit, where she
reunites with Laurence, who was looking for the pair. Martha soon

tells her whole smitten and obilivious family that they are

telling him that Julia is leaving and taking the job in Paris.
Martha then realizes that she really loves Doug and makes up with

death, driving him to the Newberry house and holing up inside,
narrowly ahead of Grocer and his mercenaries. Martin appears on
the base to produce a show for the enlisted men and (at his

machinations to Sheila, who embraces him in relief and calls on

dissuade her from this approach, later enlisting the help of his
friend Steve Adams, who tries to woo Shelley. Martin gradually
kills the team of mercenaries. Martin really wants to keep his
single lifestyle, and can't see himself as the "marrying kind".
Martin sends Sheila to town to bring Robert back before he's
declared AWOL. Martin then experiences an epiphany, recognizing
that his recent disillusionment with his work and his amends with
Debi signify an opportunity to change his life for good. Martin's
ever-suspicious wife, invited by Curtis, arrives and Sonya is
forced to leave the show as well, which is canceled for want of a
leading lady. Martin, concluding that it is futile to try to
change his life, fires his psychiatrist over the phone, notifies
Marcella that he is laying her off (but directs her to a brick of
cash hidden in the office, set aside for her severance pay) and
finally opens the dossier containing the details of the contract
that brought him to Grosse Pointe. Martindale, having himself
been at the charity ball, finds himself to be a chance spectator
of the reunion. Martini and the studio soon learn of Wilbur and

anyway and that it means nothing to him now. Marty also said that

and sees the girl dancing with Nick. Marty had an impression that

late to disclose his feelings to Sally pointing out that if he
did he would be the "first in line" if Sally and her boyfriend
broke up. Marvin Payne (Stewart) is a World War II army air force

Tate and Craig begin a passionate and exciting relationship. Mary

giving up the chase quickly but angrily. Mary fears that Steve

Mary quickly gets out of her wedding dress and projects strength

Mary's father Isaac disapproves of the romance and provides an

Mary's rescue plan works, but she lets Hartman take the credit.

that life isn’t a fairytale and marrying Massimo is the right

goodbye to Aunt Sally, as they sadly wave to each other. Marylin
and her lawyer, Freddy Bender (Richard Jenkins), fail to reach an

his considerable wealth is at risk. Marylin insists on the Massey
prenup, which will make it absolutely impossible for her to claim

(Julia Duffy), warns Marilyn that Miles will be a dangerous
opponent. Masha escapes her prison in a surfboard shack and finds

reveals that he couldn't go ahead with the wedding knowing that

"Richard". Matters reach a head when it appears that Ernest and

Maura then manages to convince the immigration detectives that

Mauricio confesses to Hal the truth about Robbins' hypnotherapy,

to undo the hypnosis. Maury bans Zach from the Slocum house and
seeing Beth, but Zach continues to sneak in. Maury catches them,
knocks Zach unconscious, and takes Beth. Maury picks up Zach and
tells him that Beth is extremely upset, insisting that Zach tell
her that he lied about her death and promise to be with her
forever; Zach reluctantly agrees. Max Herschel, the married,
wealthy, vulgar, egotistical, middle-aged head of a corporate

producer "Bones" Burton, just as it is, but she wants a more

Max and Maria begin dating due to their shared passion in

Max becomes enamoured with the beautiful, feisty café owner

an actor in the theater's current production of The Cherry

proof of Christie's heritage. Max gets separated in an attempt to
hide his attentions to the maid from the father and ultimately
finds his way back to the main house where he finds the maid on
