employees. Max has two toes amputated. Max invalidates the
estate's sale with the farewell letter he gave to Christie, which
he forged, along with real photos confirming Christie as Henry's
daughter with a valid claim to the estate  (as a child Max signed
cheques for his uncle, and is able to replicate his handwriting
and signature). Max is concerned that she might lay claim to the
estate and brusquely interrogates her during dinner at the Duflot
house. Max is forced to bunk with Stan, and they share their
thoughts about each other's lives. Max is touched by the apology,
and reveals that he is actually Michelle, also a zerophiliac. Max
leaves, but on the day of Donna's abortion, he arrives at her
home with flowers and asks if he can accompany her to her
procedure. Max marries Maria, and on the way to their honeymoon,
discover Max's one-eyed bulldog, Lucky, in the car with them. Max
must have surgery. Max pronounces Westley to be merely "mostly
dead", and returns him to life (out of a desire to get back at
Humperdinck), though Westley remains partially paralyzed and
weak. Max reacts with outrage, and the father reveals the
deception. Max survives and tells Lola to get the diamond. Max
tells him: "You were the last person I thought would ever come
through for me". Max tracks Donna down at the bookstore where she
works and they have the first of several awkward conversations.
Max tries to defend his action by explaining it as art. Max's
uncle suggests the eldest daughter as a good match, but she fears
that Max will be more interested in her younger sister. Max,
however, is not a man to accept defeat in any of his endeavors,
and he retaliates with a vengeance. Maxl gives him the money.
Maxl loaned him 900,000 francs (which he embezzled), and Victor
has not repaid anything. May overhears and invites people to her
birthday party, intending it to be a going-away party for Johnny.
Maya correctly guesses that "Emily" is her mother. Maya is happy
to have figured out the story, but she realizes that her father
still loves April: he changed the name of her mother, Sarah, to
Emily in the story, and the name of Natasha to Summer, but he did
not change April's name. Maya makes Will have an epiphany,
realizing that he is miserable without April. Maya states that it
is unfortunate that the story has a sad ending, but Will explains
that the story has a happy ending: Maya. Maybe if Bruno, with the
help of his best pal Blake, can score tickets and give Caroline a
night to remember, he can keep this miracle alive. Mayberry's
wife Sue (Merle Oberon) has indeed divorced him, although she
still loves him. Mayme, however, is not granted a promotion, but
gets heavily criticized for constantly being late at work by the
head of personnel, Miss Streeter (Edna May Oliver). Mayor Harris
wishes him well, warning him to run and says he will tell mrs

the city has been giving its workers. McKay finally manages to
leave safely by putting on a woman's dress. McKay invites himself
to do the same. McKay swings trapeze-like on a rope, catching her
hands in mid-fall and depositing her safely on a ledge. McKeever
"allows" Mike to move in, but treats him as a servant. McKeever
takes them to court, arguing that Laura was an unlicensed,
illegal lobbyist; but, when she is forced to admit on the stand
that she had another, romantic, reason for seeing him, the case
is dropped. McKeever uses these votes to replace the entire
Board. McKeever winds up taking in homeless ex-GI. McKenna tells
her that he thinks she is beautiful and a relationship is still
an option. McKinley reveals that it was then that he met with the
third kind&nbsp;— those who die with a smile on their face.
McKinley, in his diary, states that he had met two type of people
in his life, those who died without uttering a sound and those
who died with lots of anguish, crying over their deaths.
McNugent, best friends since fifth grade and Neil Diamond fans
throughout, form a Neil Diamond tribute band called "Diamonds in
the Rough". Me and My Gal was directed by Raoul Walsh, one of the

it was filmed at the time that the speeding ticket claimed Adam
had been driving with Brianna, and deduces that the only person
who could have sent it was Jeannie. Meanwhile, Samantha gets
kidnapped by a hit man named Leroy, who tells her that Jerry
hired him to make sure she is safe from anybody that wants her
dead. Meanwhile, Samantha has been approached by an Arab sheikh
to devise a PR campaign for his business. Meanwhile, Samantha

booed off the stage and assaults a member of the audience.
Meanwhile, Sandy, a self-centered, former teen idol, is trying to
make a comeback by having a documentary filmed about his starring

promises to consult Judge Stillwell about evicting Stretch and

capitalist system and its degenerates up side down. Meeting
several other rich American teenagers down by the pool -

father's boss -, Katey becomes disgusted when one of the
teenagers insults a local waiter when he accidentally knocks over

attending a boxing match and are immediately worried. Meg and Ken
are playing with Natalie, and Robin carries on partying. Meg no

restaurant. Meg then leaves the office, and George, rebuffing his
boss, dashes from his desk. Meg wants to have a baby. Meg,
concerned to believe that he is not truly committed, ends the
relationship, with Ken walking away. Megan (Keira Knightley) is
an aimless twenty-eight-year-old who is in a committed

by pretending that she has a week-long career advice seminar to

who is also living with Larry and Lloyd, plan to win back Graham
and Clayton. Megan and Graham sneak away one night to have sex
and begin to fall in love. Megan entreats Graham to join them as
well, but Graham nervously declines. Megan goes to Craig's house,

again. Megan goes to the meeting and afterwards asks Annika if,

single, and one day she joins a dating website. Megan is visibly

from Annika asking her to pretend to be her absentee mother at a

and that Craig has no idea. Megan then explains the situation to
him in six monosyllables: "Grace has Bob's dead wife's heart.

Annika to be honest and pursue Junior, a friend whom she is in
love with. Melanie and Brad start talking and then dancing.

going to marry her and begins to woo her aggressively. Melville
"Ironpants" Goodwin (Kirk Douglas) is a much-decoratedS. Melvin

remains under the false impression that he is romantically
involved with the much-younger Talia. Meredith and Ben are a
couple, as are Everett and Julie and Amy and Brad. Meredith
breaks down in front of the family. Meredith defends her
stepbrother's behavior, explaining that it stems from the fact
their father was a violent man who was physically abusive to them

Meredith desperately tries to fit in, but her strained attempt to

department store on the Upper East Side of Manhattan. Merlin
(Charles Coburn), is sympathetic to the "unwed mother" and

women in their lives (such as their wives, sisters, daughters and
nieces) and questions if they would have them do what they're
trying to force her to do (marrying people they don't love). Mia
reveals to Harper that she was diagnosed with cancer more than a
year ago and is dying. Mia then takes off her wig, forcing Lance
to also acknowledge the severity of her condition. Mia thinks
Nicholas set her up, while he insists he had no idea. Mia tries
to calm Lance down to no avail. Mia's best friend Lilly Moscovitz
(Heather Matarazzo) surprises her by visiting. Mia's girlfriend
Danni (Radha Mitchell) is keen to move in, but Mia fears
commitment. Mibs insists on driving Johnny to Mexico, but they
are caught. Michael Ashburn (Derrick De Marney) is the chief
assistant to Rufus Trent (Cecil Kellaway), a wealthy London loan
broker. Michael Caine is Matthew Hollis, married to Karen
(Valerie Harper), and father to teenaged daughter, Nikki (Demi
Moore). Michael Dorsey (Dustin Hoffman) is a respected but
perfectionist actor. Michael Felgate is an English auctioneer
living in New York where he manages the Cromwell auction house.
Michael Finnegan, a past-his-prime journalist, has been relegated
to ghost-writing Dear Felicity, a column for the lovelorn.
Michael Hamilton (Gable), a Philadelphia lawyer, travels to
Naples, Italy only a few days before his planned wedding to
settle the estate of his late brother, Joseph with Italian lawyer
Vitalli (De Sica). Michael Murphy (Edward Burns), his lawyer and
best friend from college, still carries a flame for former
girlfriend Kate, even though their relationship ended badly.
Michael Pappas (Peter Gallagher) and Cathy Featherstone (Daryl
Hannah), a young couple from Chicago who have just graduated from
college in the United States, have known each other about 10
years and have been together about half that time. Michael Ryan
is a high school student who receives an anonymous love letter.
Michael and Cameron help him by prying Bianca for information on
Kat's likes and dislikes. Michael angrily tells his parents the
letter actually belongs to him while scolding them for invading
his private mail, leaving them in a state of shock. Michael
arrives home with a cold after his night in jail. Michael asks

dissatisfied with the relationship. Michael assists by convincing
Joey to pay Patrick to take out Kat, under the pretense that this
will allow Joey to date Bianca. Michael believes Sandy is too
emotionally fragile to handle the truth about him winning the
part, especially after noticing her strong resentment of Dorothy.
Michael confesses, "I was a better man with you as a woman than I
ever was with a woman as a man". Michael continues to hold his

Theodora out of her confining routine, ignoring her protests that
she likes her life just the way it is. Michael declares that he

no longer be invited to the wedding. Michael discovers to his
dismay that his brother spent a fortune on fireworks. Michael
discreetly gives Julianne the invitation to tell him she's in

eventually meets Stephanie and quickly becomes smitten with her.
Michael experiences a series of wacky adventures with his friends
throughout the summer before his Senior year in High School.
Michael explains that they cannot be removed, but one of the
robbers threatens to cut Julie's ears off to get to them. Michael
finds a clever way to extricate himself. Michael hurries her off
when he sees Julie inside the shop vault. Michael is a failure at
speaking the romantic words he wrote, however, and after his
screen test proves a dismal failure, he decides to return to
Buxton. Michael is confused when he learns that the two women are
developing a friendship, but he quickly recovers and the three of
them spend a few days gradually getting closer. Michael is given
a hidden recording device and is tasked with trying to record
Vito into admitting his criminal activity on tape before he is
"executed". Michael is obsessed with Deborah Ann Fimple, the
class beauty, and his best friend, Roger, convinces him that the
letter is from her. Michael is socially prominent, but works for
a living. Michael is upset, thinks that she declined his offer
for Charlie and is ready to go. Michael phones Sarah and she goes
to stay with him, sharing her Christmas scarf. Michael plays his
character as a feisty, feminist administrator, which surprises
the other actors and crew who expected Emily to be (as written)
another swooning female in the plot. Michael ponders over his
continuing charade he puts on for Stephanie ("Charades"). Michael
retorts that he will not let this happen, but barely is their
engagement party over before he is unwittingly involved in a
money laundering scam, and soon the FBI takes an interest in him.
Michael reveals that he wants her to go with him and another
woman to Utah (where polygamy is legal) so they can marry and
support him while he writes. Michael rushes to the dockyard after
a brief scuffle with Steve, screaming his love for Toni. Michael
starts singing their song as he grabs Julianne and holds her
while they dance one last time. Michael suggests they invite Tom
to spend time at their country estate, where he can become better
acquainted with their son Roger (Tom Sturridge). Michael takes
Julie to her hotel room and stays with her when she pretends to
be sick after her night outside. Michael takes the job as a way
to raise $8,000 to produce a play, written by his roommate Jeff
Slater (Bill Murray) and to star Sandy, titled Return to Love
Canal. Michael tells Judy he needs time alone, then says he can't
help still having feelings for Sally. Michael tracks her to her
hometown, and his whistling is immediately noticed outside her
house. Michael tries to fend off Renee's advances by steering
Fassbender her way, but Fassbender's wife Anna is determined to
keep him to herself. Michael walks in on this and has become fed
up with his mother and decides to show tough love and tells his
mother that she must apologize to Candace, but she refuses.
Michael writes Deborah Ann an anonymous love letter in return,
and asks Toni to give it to her. Michael's overbearing mother
Loretta (Jenifer Lewis) doesn't approve of his engagement with
Candace, still thinking no woman is good enough for her son.
Michael's plan fails, and when Vito realises that his execution
is a set-up, he orders Vinnie to kill Michael. Michael, however,
is suspicious over Elvira's supposed willingness to go on the

archaeologist on temporary assignment at the nearby Akrotiri
excavation. Michelle has doubts regarding that Jim's paternal

question. Michelle's parents, who were initially skeptical of

comforts the weeping girl, and they go on a date. Mick gets upset

plays for the Dragons, an opposing team who tends to bully Scott
on the court. Mick tells Pamela that they should leave, but she
tells him to "drop dead" and storms off while everyone else
celebrates the victory. Mickey Gordon is a National Basketball
Association referee who honors his recently-deceased father's
wishes by burying him at the resting site of his World War II
Army platoon in France, of which he was the sole survivor, but
the plans are delayed after the airline misplaces the casket.
Mickey Mouse, Donald Duck, Goofy, and Mickey's dog Pluto are
street urchins, who, while being robbed by masked bandits (played
by the Beagle Boys) are saved by the Royal Musketeers, Athos,
Aramis, Porthos and D'Artagnan. Mickey almost alerts Willie to
his presence by sneezing after falling into a box of powder in
Willie's pocket, but the same powder makes Willie sneeze and he
loses sight of Mickey. Mickey and Ellen arrive at the restaurant
together and re-tell Liz the story of their relationship. Mickey
and Minnie finally declare their love for one another, as do the
others (Donald and Daisy, Goofy and Clarabelle). Mickey arrives
just in time to finish the job of cutting down the beanstalk, and
Willie, who was climbing down, falls to his apparent death.
Mickey calls Eve's house, and when Nancy answers pleads to come
over and crash, hanging up before he realizes who she is. Mickey
comes back to the bar the next night when he is unable to pay for
a bus ticket home to Las Vegas. Mickey decides to delay his
return trip to the United States to spend time with Ellen. Mickey
decides to go AWOL from his job and immediately return to Paris
to find Ellen. Mickey encourages his friends not to lose hope and
they rush to rescue Minnie and Daisy. Mickey frees his friends
and they make a break for it with the harp. Mickey goes back to
Eve's house to recover his suitcase, and Zack finds him there and
assaults him again. Mickey goes to Pearl's apartment to crash,
and when he wakes up begins taking pictures as she sleeps. Mickey
is also defeated, leaving the three heroes stranded. Mickey is
gifted one of their hats, inspiring them to follow their example
and become a musketeer; however, in the present day, he, Donald
and Goofy are janitors for the musketeers' base. Mickey is
suspended by the NBA for a week. Mickey is then captured by Pete,
who chains him up in a dungeon in Mont Saint-Michel that will
flood when the tide comes in. Mickey learns Ellen is married but
separated, and is unsure if she and her husband will get back
together. Mickey neglects his wife, Janice, who once had been a
"Miss Luxemberg" in a successful ad campaign featuring various
attractive models. Mickey plays palm reader and gains the
childish giant's trust. Mickey refuses to move away from
California, so Ellen takes the airline's other offer of a
transfer to Paris. Mickey rides back to Paris with Ellen, and the
two get to know each other along the way. Mickey sneezes when
Willie pours pepper and tries to run away, but Willie catches
him. Mickey stalls him long enough for Donald and Goofy to reach
the bottom and begin sawing the beanstalk. Mickey then decides to
sell the cow for money to buy food. Mickey's loneliness leads him
to lose his temper during a nationally-televised game. Mickey,
Donald and Goofy are dubbed (by Princess Minnie) royal
musketeers. Mickey, Donald and Goofy arrive and battle Pete and
the Beagle Boys onstage, finally defeating them and saving Daisy
and the Princess (though what became of the villains is unknown).
Mickey, Donald and Goofy manage to save Minnie and Daisy in a
tower where the Beagles are keeping them. Mickey, unhappy at home
with Arthur, decides to return early to the NBA. Mickler, who is
about to retire, insists on doing the evaluation and conducts it
without medicating the youth. Middle daughter Carmen (Jacqueline
Obradors) shares her father's passion for food but has stifled
her dream of owning a restaurant in favor of pursuing a more
stable career as a business analyst. Middle-aged, divorced and
wealthy from his work in real estate, Frank lacks for nothing
material. Middle-class family man Stanley Banks reminisces on

her ex-husband, Bobby Jack Moriarty (Brian Kerwin), to move back
in with her and their 12-year-old son, Jake (Corey Haim). She
becomes good friends with fellow intern Kit (Juliette Hing-Lee),
and spends her days phoning radio stations and running errands.
She becomes his indispensable aide, and he calls her for every
little thing. She becomes pleasant, particularly towards Stifler,
making Michelle and Jim's dad unknowingly happy. She becomes
proficient and skips two levels to become a junior skater. She
becomes serious with Luke, but an incident at a restaurant in
which he is rude to one of the waiters makes her realize he isn't
the one she wants, either. She becomes very angry and slaps him
and explodes with all her cruelty to him and leaves. She
befriends them and calls her friend Woody to come and drain the
pool so the aliens can work on their ship and get it flying
again. She begins dating Anthony, who offers to marry her. She
begins to annoy Sheldon and Lisa (with the whole city now
watching) by constantly talking to strangers about his most
embarrassing moments. She begins to date Bill (Kevin Corrigan),
the local clerk at the video rental store she frequents. She
begins to enjoy her life to the extent that her "pregnancy"
becomes real to her. She begins to find herself dissatisfied and
depressed and so returns to Jenny's house to beg her to let her
take the children back home. She begins to spank him, before she
is thrown out of the hotel by the staff. She begins to understand
the intense love her mother has for her, and leans toward
Northwestern. She begins to wear more provocative clothing and
stitches a red "A" to everything she wears. She begs him to do
something to keep Paul from leaving. She begs him to let her
finish what she started here and not let the summer go to waste.
She believes he is Prince William until he convinces her a
thousand years have passed and he is not the Prince (although
Jason and his mother mention his family history, leading the
audience to believe that Jason is the descendant of the Prince).
She believes he is truly a tramp, and buys him a breakfast of
eggs and ham. She bends down to get it when a man shows up and
selects the same song she would have chosen. She berates Julius
by dismissing all his stories as lies. She bets Stifler that if
she wins at poker he has to apologise to her and run naked in the
snow. She blindfolds Lorenzo and kisses him passionately out of
love. She books him a contract in Michigan that coincides with
the reunion, ostensibly to smooth things over with the client
whose contract was botched. She breaks free and attempts to wash
the stripe and the smell off but is unsuccessful. She breaks off
her marriage with Dill and joins Jeff on the boat—when Dill
arrives at the wharf, the ship has already sailed. She breaks
through his anger by reminding him that she, as a female, had to
endure a lot of trash talk from others, but didn't let it get her
down, allowing her to become the best girl boxer in Brooklyn. She
breaks up with Brian and gives Lena's younger sister, Effie (Lucy
Hale), permission to date him. She breaks up with him. She brings
Nuria to the restroom for a chat, telling her that American women
behave differently with men. She brings her opinionated friend
Lysterine "Lysti" (Vivica Fox), and Rushon comes with his "bad
boy" buddy Bunz (Jamie Foxx). She buys up controlling interest in
the company and moves into his home as the new tenant. She calls

and asks him to meet her outside her work. She calls and invites
Sydney, who is, unbeknownst to them, already en route to the
wedding. She calls the tour company looking for him. She calls
them, then realizes what had really occurred and gets her
boyfriend arrested. She calls, but Evie and Randy have already
absconded and she is left talking to a furious Evelyn. She can't
wait to get back to California and her career, but when Charley
reneges on his promise, Vicki promptly gets a divorce. She cannot
forgive Grant, and agrees to marry Nicky. She cannot help but
wonder what would happen if she ever got together with her high
school sweetheart, Tom, who she had never slept with. She cares a
great deal about Fuzzy22, and feels that a man as attractive as
he is would, upon seeing her, become disappointed and
uninterested and she could not bear that from him. She catches
Anne and Rebecca in bed together and walks out. She causes
further talk when she brings a newborn baby with her. She

have been, particularly because they have never been there for
all the small but important life events of their daughter. She
changes her mind after sharing a moment with her great-
grandmother (Bess Meisler) and realizing she really wants to go

worse. She chases after Andre to get his autograph, but her pen
seems to be out of ink. She chases down Pam and asks her to stay.
She checks to see if Bob is home but discovers he is with June,
one of her co-workers. She chooses the latter. She claims she is
on the run because when she cashed her check from a walkathon she

named Roogle (Clem Bevans) who died on their wedding night. She
claims that their relationship is 'strictly business' and leaves

of a building and strips off her clothes to commit suicide. She
coerces him into taking her into the city and invites him to the

1882 novel by Anstey, in which the protagonists are a father and
son. The book also contains some motifs that appear in almost all

derivatives; in other versions of the tale it may be made of
other materials (in the version recorded by the Brothers Grimm,
German: Aschenbroedel and Aschenputtel, for instance, it is gold)
and in still other tellings, it is not a slipper but an anklet, a
ring, or a bracelet that gives the prince the key to Cinderella's
identity. The incantations fail at first, but Chucky suddenly

recommendations. When Eddie sees Kiki at the junket she has lost
weight and is now physically attractive. When Edith and George
wander off, the two bond as they try to reunite with the tour.
When Edmund Tilney, the Master of the Revels, is informed there
is a woman player at The Rose, he closes the theatre for breaking
the ban on women. When Effie decides to stop the divorce, a
little scene staged by the lawyer, with his girlfriend, Nan,
posing as the blonde Henry was supposedly seeing, convinces her
otherwise. When Elaine gives her crooked pal Gilbert Landon
(Sidney Blackmer) a diamond pendant given her by Bradley, in
order to keep Landon quiet about her past, she pretends the
pendant was stolen, in hopes of hiding the truth from Bradley.
When Eliot asks what she'll do next, she mentions that Dan has a
new job in Cincinnati, and she'll probably follow him there to
resume her singing there. When Eliza decides to leave Higgins, he
insults her in frustration and storms off. When Elizabeth learns
that Amy and Scott are chaperoning an upcoming field trip, she
smears an apple with poison ivy and leaves it for Amy, who ends
up with her face breaking out in blisters, so she cannot go. When
Ellen tracks him down before his honeymoon night, he is at a loss
as to how to break the news to Bianca. When Ellie suspects Peter
has sold her out, she returns home. When Ellie's father presses
him for an explanation of his odd behavior, Peter admits he loves
Ellie, and storms out. When Elwood learns that David is not
technically a citizen of the United States, he has the young man
arrested for illegally entering the country. When Emily is
waylaid by a mysterious illness, Kumail must take charge of the
crisis with her parents, Beth and Terry. When Epifania becomes
smitten with Alastair, a muscular tennis player, she rigs the
contest by giving him £500 in stock and then buying it back for
£15,000. When Erik returns to the Beta house to pick up his
friends the next morning, each boy shares stories of his
experiences from the night before. When Estelle comes to the
Pooles' house, Augie is unaware of her identity and, believing
she works for a local charity, drinks two cocktails and behaves
casually. When Eve's married lover, Zack, calls looking for her,
Nancy asks penetrating questions and begins dispensing
relationship advice, despite the fact that she herself has been
unable to maintain a successful relationship. When Evie’s mother
leaves on a business trip, the girls take the opportunity to cook
a huge meal, indulging in wine and marijuana. When Fella's (Jerry
Lewis) father dies, he continues to live with his wicked
stepmother, Emily (Judith Anderson), and her two sons, Maximilian
(Henry Silva) and Rupert (Robert Hutton). When Flostre wakes up,
he tries to make a pass at Jo. When Fran leaves the pair to dance
together Mary angrily rebukes him for leading her on and going
behind Fran’s back. When Frances learns the truth about Paul, she
changes her impression of him and they embark on a romance. When
Frank is also bitten, he tells Ryan and Deb to flee while he
holds off the soldiers. When Frank yells at Julia to get an
order, she turns to respond and hits Grant over the head with the
coffee pot she is holding, knocking him to the floor. When Fred
and Emily board the junk, they are left unmolested and even fed.
When Freddie meets Jjaks (Keanu Reeves), Sam's brother, they
instantly fall in love. When Freddie performs for him, he
remembers her and kisses her on the forehead. When Gabriella
finally gains the confidence to step forward, Troy offers to sing
with her, but ms Darbus (Alyson Reed) tells them that they are
too late. When Gary arrives at the party, his dreams of a lasting
romance with Karen are shattered when he sees Karen making out
with Rick. When Gary goes out for a drink with Johnny, his friend
points out that Gary has always had his guard up, has been guilty
of a lot of selfishness, and never gave Brooke a chance,
emotional intimacy-wise. When Gavin, the popular editor of the
school paper, fires him, Eddie obtains revenge by establishing an
underground paper of his own. When Gene enters the study, he
confronts a lonely Art, and again threatens him if he doesn't
marry Betty. When Geoffrey tells Monica that she would be better
off with Austin, she is disdainful of the suggestion. When George
asks her about it, he assumes she wants to have an affair with
him, despite the fact his wife and she are friends. When George
expresses his skepticism, Jimmy bets him $5,000 that he can prove
his contention. When George is seemingly having difficulty
deciding on the man, his eyes alight on Peter, who he selects.
When George offers his life insurance policy as collateral,
Potter says George is worth more dead than alive and phones the
police to have him arrested. When George overhears Steve
discussing his "retirement" with Caroline, he vows to prevent the
marriage and enlists Maria Dorango (Jacqueline Dalya), an
aspiring actress posing as a Latin-American singer, to help him.
When George says he wishes he had never been born, Clarence
decides to grant his wish and show George an alternate timeline
in which he never existed. When Gerald asks her why her Thenol
pills failed to work, she asks him how he knew about them,
thinking that he has already found out about her taking
Prudence's pills, at which point they both realise that she has
revealed her guilt. When Glen Apollo (John Lloyd Cruz) finds
himself surrounded by friends who are beginning to settle down,
he is faced with the possibility of finding his true love. When
Glenn threatens Billy, a burly fan of his also wearing biker
attire forces Glenn down the aisle and a female flight attendant
he tried seducing earlier pushes him into the lavatory. When
Gloria invites Jeremy and John to an extended weekend party at
their family compound, John overrules Jeremy to accept and get
closer to Claire. When Gomer later shows Barney a picture he took
of Goober with something unidentifiable in the background, Barney
becomes convinced there's a monster in the lake. When Grace
arrives and sees this, she storms out; Bruce follows her, but she
is heartbroken and will not listen to him. When Granny Weatherwax
realizes Nanny Ogg has written an immensely popular cookbook but
has not been paid by the publisher, the witches also leave for
Ankh-Morpork to collect the money, as well as to attempt to
recruit Agnes into their coven, to replace Magrat Garlick who
left the coven when she became Queen of Lancre (in Lords and
Ladies). When Grant says he has a best man, she shows them what
she booked for the entertainment, after which she uses her butt
to knock over her desk then rips off her clothes to reveal a gold
liquid spandex tight suit. When Gray eventually 'comes out' to
Sam, he tells her he's known all along, since they were young
kids. When Grey accidentally collides with Bill for real, she
insists on putting the two up for the night, even over the
objections of her snotty fiance Walker McCormick. When Gupta,
assuming he was acting a coward, learns of the situation he was
put into, he decides to take the burden off Viktor by running in
front of the plane to Krakozhia as it taxies to the terminal,
choosing to let himself be deported back to his home country in
order to let his friend go to New York. When Gus falls in love
with Emily (Gertz), he adopts the persona of Lobo Marunga, a
leather-clad biker from New Zealand. When Guy makes advances, she
finally blurts out that she's married and can't leave her husband
because it would destroy him, and finally storms out. When Halley
walks in on her best friend Scarlett having sex with her
boyfriend, the high school soccer champ, Michael Sherwood, Halley
tries to warn her of the complications that lie ahead. When

Santo could "crush him like an eggshell". When Hank tries to

suspend him from the club, and Hank is then arrested by Joe
Reagan (Roger Pryor), the local policeman. When Harley questions
the absence of sex in the surveys, Judith says she does not
believe in premarital sex. When Harold finishes his shift, he
sees an old friend from his hometown who is now a policeman
walking the beat. When Harold makes too sharp a turn, the two are
thrown into the river. When Harold points out how Kimberly's
behavior is similar to Tammy's, Tammy tells him to shut up and he

decides to withdraw, until he witnesses Cole make a pass at
Handy's girlfriend of six years, veterinarian dr Sally Mannis,
who recently broke up with him because he was taking the

When Harvey lets slip that Susan will likely stay in a juvenile

friends with Areida, Ella runs away and learns that her father is
attending a giant's wedding. When Heather gets home, she finds
Cindy sleeping in her bed. When Helen mentions Andy and Barney

Henry goes back to the café, Lucy does not have any recollection

enthusiastic government regulator Hector Vanson (John Astin)

uses her feminine charms to get Judd Evans, a factory clerk, to
pay the rent for an apartment in his building. When Irma decides
to leave Paris with the fictitious Lord X, Nestor decides to end

a sundress. When Isolde has Augie's baby picture blown up and

they slip away from the group together and miss the bus back to

service however, Joan's socially-ambitious mother (Ellen Pollock)

the attentions of Joan's older boss Adolphus Pickering (Claud
Allister), who is infatuated with her. When Jagged sings "Viva

she convinces a girls crew team to take her out to him. When Jake

When Julia's performance in her current play begins to suffer

body) finds out, she gets very upset. When Nellie becomes

Michael's old friend Timothy Fogarty (Arthur Shields), the
squabbling between Nellie's father and grandfather intensifies,
as Michael objects to the romance, and finally leaves home
because of it. When Nelson visits George the next day in his
shabby storefront law office, and offers to make him the legal
representative for his company, George is suspicious and refuses
the offer, but Nelson allays his concerns by telling the ethical
young attorney that he needs an honest lawyer as a role model for

can keep him occupied while he pursues Louise. When New York
butcher Leo Lemke shows up on the tiny North Carolina island of
Ocracoke, where Marina lives, she is convinced that he is the man
predestined to be her husband. When Newman meets Oscar and Peter,
he assumes that they are lovers, even though Oscar is straight.
When Nick confronts Ellen, she recruits a mousy shoe salesman (an
uncredited Chester Clute) to pretend to be Stephen, but Nick has
already tracked down the real, appallingly virile and handsome
Stephen (Randolph Scott). When Nick is confronted by Ellen, he
eventually clears things up with Bianca, but he then learns that
the entire time Ellen was stranded on the island she was there
with another man, the handsome, athletic Stephen Burkett (Chuck
Connors) - and that they called each other "Adam" and "Eve". When
Nick talks about what he wants in a woman, he doesn't notice
Lauren's momentary reaction to 'unmarried. When Nikhil comes to
Meeta's house to run away with her, he sees Karishma with her
family and returns home, realizing the complications. When Nikki
begins to deliberately seduce Richard, he does not know what to
do. When Nora asks Mary if she loves Rodrigo, Mary tells her that
she just wants to go back to Beverly Hills and that Rodrigo can
make that happen. When Nora becomes afraid of her feelings and
that it would destroy her career, she coldly informs Edward that
she is "just another girl who answered an ad in the paper" to him
and drives him away. When Nora receives a promotion and transfer
away from Edward, she quits rather than have people believe she
slept her way up. When Norbit realizes that Rasputia is cheating
on him with her dance instructor Buster Perkin (Marlon Wayans),
she carelessly brushes it off like nothing happened. When Norbit
returns home, he learns that Rasputia somehow witnessed the whole
thing and she threatens to kill Kate if she ever sees Norbit with
her again. When Norton discovers the man she is in love with is
really Doherty, she tries to quit the show, only to find out that
it would breach her contract. When Norval discovers that Trudy
has borne not just one son but six, he faints, and the movie ends
with this epilogue on a title card:. When O'Hara is found with
LeBlanc, who is shot by two Nazi agents, she is placed under
house arrest. When Paddy and Sam return, they find that Archie is
up to $102,000, and they quickly leave the table in fear of being
accused of card counting. When Parsons brings the police, looking
for his truck, Lambert leads them to the thieves. When Patricia
finally awakens, she is deeply touched by Joe's self-sacrifice.
When Patrick arrives there, Emma and Patrick get married and
leave in the fire truck. When Patterson realizes that Pat and
David have long expected to marry, he contrives to obtain medical
clearance to go back to combat duty. When Patti sells Murphy a
new apartment, and Brian publishes his personal novel, these old
friends reconnect in unexpected ways. When Paul accuses Tony of
misappropriating company funds, Tony protects his boss with his
silence. When Paul tells Tony that Julius is with Amelia, Tony
decides not to see Amelia again, nor answer her calls. When Peggy
returns to the camp, it is revealed that she was never the true
owner of the lumber camp, but this does not matter to Clayton,
who is love with Peggy. When Peggy wakes, she finds herself back
in the spring of 1960 during her senior year of high school,
having passed out after donating blood in the school gym (where
the reunion was). When Pepé climbs out he is blue. When Pepé goes
back into the perfume shop to look for the female skunk, he hears
the door shut and the lock click behind him. When Pepé returns
with the glass of water, he finds she has run off. When Peter
comes to Ellie's home, mr Andrews offers him the reward money,
but Peter insists on being paid only his expenses: a paltry
$3960. When Peter confronts Sarah, she tells him she began
feeling disconnected emotionally from him and she couldn't do
anything to make their relationship work. When Peter tries to
talk to Lara Jean, Josh steps in to try and protect her, and

grandfather has died, leading the Brents to take her in. When

photos, a feud escalates between the mobsters and Crenshaw,
Collins and Armstrong. When Philip stops to visit her on his way

own mother and Philip leaves without learning the truth. When

Monique's beauty, and that it is a Frenchman's nature to be

and Jose separately converge on the office, he is finally
revealed to be a fraud financed by Kendal. When Pierre accepts,

weapons are a bottle of vodka each. When Pike meets "Eve", he is
so bewildered he constantly trips and falls over himself. When

allows Duncan to continue seeing Hallie and strikes up a

him for the previous three days to think things through. When
